result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:23 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson.  Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. States requests counts 1,3,4 be found transactionally related. No objection. Court so finds.  Witness J.R. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Defendant identified. - Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TLH or KKK. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
